intro: Saussurea nakagawae, commonly known as the Nakagawa saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and pale yellow to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it adapts to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
